titleStmt.title: The seuen deadly sinnes of London drawne in seuen seuerall coaches, through the seuen seuerall gates of the citie bringing the plague with them. Opus septem dierum. Tho: Dekker.
titleStmt.author: Dekker, Thomas, ca. 1572-1632.

titleStmt.title: The seuen deadly sinnes of London drawne in seuen seuerall coaches, through the seuen seuerall gates of the citie bringing the plague with them. Opus septem dierum. Tho: Dekker.
titleStmt.author: Dekker, Thomas, ca. 1572-1632.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by E[dward] A[llde and S. Stafford] for Nathaniel Butter, and are to be solde at his shop neere Saint Austens gate,

notesStmt.note: The title page is in four settings, all in red and black: (1) title has "deadlie sinns"; (2) with Good Shepherd device; (3) with device of a lion's head atop a shield; (4) with an ornament with female head and laurel leaves at top, dated 1598. There are some minor variations in imprints.
"Allde app[arently]. pr[inted]. at least piA3,4 (dedic[ation]. and to Reader); Stafford pr[inted]. at least A-C (induction and beginning of text)"--STC.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
